item.title: Blizzard Unveils Brand-New ‘Overwatch Rush’ Game
item.content:encoded:
A new announcement has arrived for Overwatch Rush, a new hero-shooter for mobile devices.

Overwatch appears to be experiencing a resurgence with the launch of Season 1. Fans of the game are already claiming that the title is making a comeback, and peak player counts are on the rise. It seems that Blizzard wants to capitalize on this newfound excitement by announcing a new entry for an additional platform.

Overwatch Rush is a Top-Down Hero-Shooter for Mobile

A new blog post by Blizzard Entertainment announces Overwatch Rush, a mobile game specifically designed for the platform. The developers have confirmed that the game is still in its early stages, and this is simply an update on its progress. The title is a top-down hero shooter set in the Overwatch universe, developed by Blizzard and separate from Team 4. Team 4 will continue to focus on the main title and provide new experiences for both PC and console players.

The developers have announced that this is an “entirely new game” and “not a port,” emphasizing that it has been created specifically for mobile players. The game is currently being tested in select countries and regions. Interested readers can join the official Discord for updates. Additionally, players can view early development gameplay of Overwatch in the video embedded below:

In other news, Overwatch developers are requesting players not to ban their overpowered Jetpack Cat. Additionally, the Overwatch x Fortnite collaboration adds Genji, Mercy, Tracer, and D.Va as new skins. What are your thoughts on Overwatch Rush being announced for mobile? item.title: 007: First Light is Taking References from Batman Arkham and Uncharted for Combat
item.content:encoded:
007: First Light’s gameplay director has revealed that the game’s combat will take references from the Batman Arkham and Uncharted series.

IO Interative’s upcoming James Bond-themed adventure is all set to release on May 27, 2026. Ahead of the launch, the developers are revealing small tidbits to build hype, and now we have been given more details about the game’s combat and other gameplay elements.

007: First Light Takes Inspiration from Arkham Games for Combat

During a new interview with Game Informer (via Gamespot), 007: First Light gameplay director Andreas Krogh spoke about drawing inspiration from Arkham Games for combat. Krogh stated that in the approach to close combat sequences, players will see references to Arkham games. But there are also “some modern takes on destructibility in the environment”, which players would not have seen in Arkham, but in games like Uncharted.

Krogh elaborated that IO Interactive has a deeper system as they want to do “more of it”. In terms of shooting, players will also see references from modern games; however, which games exactly were revealed. The developers had to explore this area, since Hitman used combat as a last resort, and the area wasn’t as deeply developed as the stealth experience, so they had to look outside to see how they could improve it.

In other news, Lenny Kravitz has commented on the inspiration for his character in 007: First Light. Additionally, here are the PC requirements for the game.
